title: Decision Destroyer
description: Transform old decisions and limitations caused by unprepared events

steps.title: Background
steps.description:
We all have moments in our life, experiences that caught us unprepared, that left unwanted emotional marks in our psyche and behaviors.

In a moment I'll walk you thru a short process but first you're probably wondering ...

answers.text: So how's this going to work Adam?

steps.title: Background - how
steps.description:
${echo}

I'm glad you asked :)

So here’s how this is going to work. I will ask you some questions, some more trivial than others, and offer you things to try.

Whatever works for you, keep, whatever doesn't, file away in the *"things I've tried and haven't worked for me yet"* drawer.

Sounds good?
steps.notes:
I will never impose anything on you. You only answer what you’re comfortable sharing, and only do what you’re comfortable doing.

Everything that we do is reversible, and we are only trying things to understand what works for YOU.

If at any point you feel uncomfortable, or something that we do isn’t to your liking, just message me, I respond personally to every single message I get.

I rely on your feedback to know how to proceed. Are we together on this?

steps.title: Background - privacy
steps.description: Most of what we’ll do together is content free, meaning I do NOT need the details of your experience, so you get total privacy.
steps.notes: I don't need the details of your memory we are about to soften, just a title for reference, i.e. "at the gym" is enough for me, as long as YOU know what memory it refers to.

answers.text: Great, I like that you respect privacy

steps.title: Background - privacy+
steps.description: Needless to say (but here I go saying it anyways, just in case ...), **EVERYTHING in our interaction stays between us**. Whatever you write or say to me, stays only with me, unless you explicitly state otherwise.
steps.notes: I don’t share anything with anyone, no matter how close to me that person is, and how much I trust them. Privacy is SACRED. No one will even know we’ve worked together.

answers.text: Privacy IS sacred. I respect that.
I like that, and I'm OK sharing

steps.title: Background - Value first model & pricing
steps.description: You decide how much to pay AFTER you’ve gotten useful results and benefits from this process, and what you learn and experience in our time together. So no need to reach for your wallet quite yet ;)
steps.notes:
Most people who come to me have been through some personal change work that was slow, expensive, not very helpful, and many times harmful.

This is my only income, and I do need $$$ to continue helping & teaching people, but giving you better control over your mind, body, and internal processes is our #1 priority.

Sounds good? Are we together on this?

answers.text: That's an interesting model, mind expanding on that?
But Adam, I REALLY can’t spend a dime

steps.title: Background - Value first model & pricing
steps.description:
***"But Adam, I REALLY can’t spend a dime"***

It’s perfectly fine. Forget about that for now. After you got some very useful shifts and learnings with me, we can talk about it. Again, giving you more control & freedom is our #1 priority here.
steps.notes: So just relax and enjoy the ride okay?

steps.title: Eliciting unprepared experience
steps.description: So think of one experience, that still affects you in a negative way, makes you feel bad to think about it now, or affects your behavior in a way that you don’t like

answers.text: Got one that still makes me feel bad
Got one that still affects my behavior in a negative way`
Got one that still affects me negatively

steps.title: Eliciting unprepared experience - Description
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, what is it?
steps.notes:
I don't need the details, a title for reference will do.
i.e. "Alone at the gym"

steps.title: Eliciting unprepared experience - Time
steps.notes: An estimate is perfectly fine.

steps.title: Break state
steps.description:
Great, you can set this unprepared experience aside now, and clear your mind by either:

1. Running your phone number backwards in your head
2. “Flashing” your mental screen (like setting the brightness all the way up in an old TV screen, just for a moment)

answers.text: I ran my phone number backwards

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Positive imprint
steps.description: In all your years on this odd planet, you had many experiences, some more meaningful than others, correct?

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Positive imprint
steps.description: So think about one of the more meaningful experiences that you had, that as you look back at it now, you're really glad it happened, and it shaped you in a positive way.
steps.notes:
It might not have seemed like that at the time, but as you look back at it NOW you know you really learned something important in there.

It could have been pleasant or unpleasant at the time of happening, as long as it shaped you in a good way, and you feel good as you remember it.

It could have been a single experience or a series of events/experiences.

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Description
steps.description: Great, what is it?
steps.notes: I don’t need the details, a title for reference will do

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Validation
steps.description:
${echo}

And as you think of that now, you feel it shaped you in a good way?
steps.notes: And you are glad it happened? You learned something important?

answers.text: No, let me choose another one

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Time
steps.description:
***"Yes"***

And roughly when was that?
steps.notes: An estimation is perfectly fine.

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Image
steps.description:
Great,
now as you think of that now:

*"${s12}"*

Allow an image to come to mind.

answers.text: I got a series of images

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Time span
steps.description:
***“Series of Images”***

OK, we’ll call these the “resource images”.

Roughly what's the time span of those resource images?
steps.notes:
I.e. They go across a few hours, few days, month, years?

An estimation is perfectly fine.

steps.title: Eliciting mundane activity
steps.description:
OK, now think about doing something mundane like brushing your teeth across the same time span:

*"${s16}"*

Around the same time you had that resource experience:

*"${s14}"*
steps.notes: Brushing your teeth is just an example of a mundane experience, you can go with something else as well, as long as it's mundane.

steps.title: Eliciting mundane activity
steps.description:
***"Single Image"***

Ok, we’ll call that the “resource image”.

Now think about doing something mundane like brushing your teeth, around the same time you had that resource experience:

*"${s14}"*
steps.notes: Brushing your teeth is just an example of a mundane experience, you can go with something else as well, as long as it's mundane.

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA)
steps.description:
Now as you think about both of these at the same time:

The resource:  
*“${s12}”*

And the mundane activity, attend to the differences in how you see, hear, and experience them in your mind.
steps.notes:
As you go back and forth between the two a few times, notice the visual, auditory, and tactile differences between the way you experience them.

What are the main differences you see, hear, and feel between the two? Write down all differences you can already notice.

Be as descriptive as possible.

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Location
steps.description: As you look at the resource and mundane images, notice the location of each one in your personal space. Where’s the resource in comparison to the mundane image?

answers.text: Resource is more in the front
Resource is more to the left
Resource is more to the right

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Brightness
steps.description: Which one is brighter?

answers.text: I don’t see any difference in brightness

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Size
steps.description: Which one is bigger?

answers.text: I don’t see any difference in size

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Distance
steps.description: Which one is physically closer to you?

answers.text: I don’t see any difference is distance

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Depth & 3D
steps.description: Which one has more depth / 3D?

answers.text: I don’t see any difference in depth

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Motion & video
steps.description: Which one has motion / is a video?

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Sound
steps.description: What are the differences in sound?

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis (CA) - Sound quality
steps.description:
Notice the sound qualities of the resource compared to the mundane, and describe the differences.

Pay particular attention to the the direction from which the sound is coming, as well as the richness, fullness, tone and tempo of the sounds.
steps.notes: Be as descriptive as you can

steps.title: New imprint experience
steps.description:
Thinking back at the "unprepared experience":
*"${s7}"*

I want you to think of something that if would have happened, would have prepared you for it in some way.

Let me give you some examples real quick, okie?

steps.title: New imprint experience - Examples
steps.description:
I had a client who overheard his parents shouting about breaking up, when he was 6, in his room late at night. Prior to this fight, he had no clue there’s “something wrong” in the family, and it took him completely by surprise.

*“If they had talked to me about it beforehand, it wouldn’t had been so traumatic. Still wouldn’t be pleasant to hear them shouting, but I would have been more prepared”*

steps.title: New imprint experience - Examples
steps.description:
Many clients adopted limitations from their families about what’s “right and wrong”, and what is difficult (i.e. the classic “making money is hard”).

Having a conversation at an early age with someone (like a smart uncle) they respected the opinion of, explaining to them that these limitations belong to their families, and have nothing to do with them, would have reframed a lot of their upbringing.

answers.text: I think I got it, let’s continue

steps.title: New imprint experience - Elicitation
steps.description:
So take a few moments and think of something that didn’t happen, but could’ve happened, and if it would have happened, it would have prepared you for this experience:

"*${s7}"*
steps.notes:
It still wouldn’t be a nice experience, but you would have been more prepared for it, and it wouldn’t bother you as much.

You can think of anything, no matter how improbable, as long as it’s possible. For example if you have a “childhood hero”, or someone famous you admired and respected, you could’ve run into them in the park. It’s improbable, but it is possible.

What I’m saying is, no “faerie dust” in here okay?

**Note**: Like everything we do together, we can always revise this later.

answers.text: Oh yea … I have a real good one …

steps.title: New imprint experience - Elicitation
steps.description:
***"Nothing comes to mind"***

Usually this happens when people “set the bar” too high. We can always revise it later, so just think of something that would have prepared you in any way, even if just a bit.

You know how some moms say *“don’t do that face or you’ll be stuck with it?”*

So this is NOT one of those cases :)

Everything we do is reversible and reviseable . So lower the bar, and start small. We’ll add modifications later if we’ll need to.

answers.text: I thought for a few minutes, still nothing

steps.title: New imprint experience - Description
steps.description: Great, what is it?
steps.notes: I don't need the details, a title for reference will do.

steps.title: New imprint experience - Time
steps.description:
${echo}

And what would be an appropriate time to have this new imprint experience?
steps.notes: I.e. a day before the negative experience, a week before, a month before, or a certain age

steps.title: New imprint experience - Validation
steps.description:
So if that experience:  
*“${s33}”*

Would have happened before the unprepared experience: 
*“${s7}”*

At that time:
*“${s34}”*

You would have been more prepared for the unprepared experience?

answers.text: I would be more prepared, yes
Actually, let me pick another one

steps.title: New imprint experience - Adding details
steps.description:
${echo}

Now go back to that time:
*“${s34}”*

And add rich details to that new imprint experience:
*“${s33}”*

Take time to “add life” to this experience, or “beef it up”, so it becomes even “juicier”.
steps.notes:
If there are other people involved, notice when they are wearing, the details of their faces, body posture, etc.

Notice what you are wearing, what are you standing on, what’s in the background, what is around you, your surroundings, etc. If it’s day time, night time, if you feel any touch on your skin, or hear anything.

answers.text: More details makes it more intense
Seems even more real this way

steps.title: New imprint experience - Intensifying
steps.description:
Now, remember the resource experience from earlier?  
*${s12}*

I want you to see, hear, and feel the new imprint experience, in the same way you see, hear, and feel the resource experience from earlier.

So go back to the beginning of that new imprint experience:

*"${s33}"*

And apply the same sensory codings we got earlier from the resource experience.

Make it as bright, as vivid, as colorful, as focused, as big, as rich in sounds and sensations.

answers.text: This makes the new imprint super powerful!
The imprint experience seems much more meaningful now
Done applying the resource experience’s coding

steps.title: New imprint experience - Carrying it through
steps.description:
${echo}

Now go back to the beginning of the new imprint experience:  
"*${s33}*"

And relive it with the new powerful coding we applied in the last step.

And after that continue to go forward through time, and notice how being this way, carrying this experience and learning with you, transforms many experiences that follow, until you get to the present age.

steps.title: Checking back
steps.description:
Thinking back on the unprepared experience you had:  
"*${s7}*"

How is it different now?

answers.text: There’s no more bad feeling or limitation attached
It’s better, but there’s still something unpleasant

steps.title: Modifications & Improvement
steps.description: Are there any modifications and alterations you can make to the new imprint experience, so that it would transform the unpleasant experience in a more useful way?

answers.text: Yes, let me make some modifications
Let me choose a new imprint experience
Let me intensify the new imprint
I don't want to try it

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description: Do you have any objections being this way?

steps.title: Future pacing
steps.description:
That's usually the case.

Now go forward into the future, being this way, carrying this new experience and learnings with you, and notice all the ways it might transform future experiences and possible scenarios that might happen.

Notice what responses and behaviors are available to you now in those future situations, being this way, carrying all these resources and learnings with you.
steps.notes: You might discover that old limitations are simply not there, or your response and behavior are much more resourceful and to your liking.

answers.text: I really like being this way
I have an objection being this way
